release_notes_vulns_justification: No CVE's against this project, only dependencies.
test_justification: Jest, run via GitLab CI on commit
static_analysis_justification: GitLab Code Quality (CodeClimate), GitLab SAST, GitLab Secret Detection, GitLAb Vulnerability Scanning, OWASP Dependency Check

dependency_monitoring_justification: GitLab dependency scanning and OWASP dependency check run on all commits, or at least weekly. Also runs weekly scans on Snyk.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: Jest tests run in CI on all commits on targeted platforms and Node.js frameworks.
regression_tests_added50_justification: Regression tests added for all bugs, 100% coverage.
implement_secure_design_justification: SAST testing performed on all commits per https://gitlab.com/gitlab-ci-utils/pa11y-ci-reporter-html/-/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

name: cobol-check
description: A unit testing framework for Cobol applications
sites_https_justification:
Given only https: URLs.

Standard GitHub URLs.
interact_justification:
The GitHub issues feature is typically used for reporting bugs and posting questions and suggestions to the team. https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/issues 

There used to be a discussion list hosted by the Open Mainframe Project, but it appears as if they have deleted it or removed its link from their pages for some reason. People used the GitHub issues feature in any case, and there was very little traffic on the OMP list.
contribution_justification:
https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/wiki/Developer-Guide

We use trunk-based development with a full-trust system rather than pull requests. All "official" team members are committers.
license_location_justification: https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/blob/main/LICENSE
floss_license_justification: I think this is a true statement, but the acronym FLOSS is unfamiliar to me. The Apache License v 2.0 is listed in the OSI license list. Are there additional requirements to meet this criterion? The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: https://opensource.org/licenses/Apache-2.0 The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: The project has extensive documentation. See https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/wiki
documentation_interface_justification: This is a standalone "batch" program. All specifications for using it are documented here: https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/wiki/User-Guide
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: We have not published the first "production" release yet. We have a series of milstone interim releases in plan.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md>.
release_notes_vulns_justification: The project is still at an early stage of development and no such problems have been identified to date.
report_responses_justification: Every issue submitted is addressed and documented. https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/issues
enhancement_responses_justification: Enhancement requests are reviewed by the development team and, if they agree to implement, they are added to the issues list with the target interim release number associated with the issue.
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: Same procedure as for reporting any other issue. https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/issues
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: We have not had an occasion when a private vulnerability report was necessary. If the situation arises, we will handle it appropriately.
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: We have no statistics on this, as we have not had any vulnerability reports yet.
build_justification: The product is distributed as an executable Java jar file. Users do not have to build it.
build_floss_tools_justification: I think this statement is true, but I was unable to find a list of FLOSS tools for purposes of satisfying this requirement. The product is written in Java and COBOL and is built with Gradle. Shell scripts are generic.
test_justification: The development team uses test-driven development and the unit test suite is included in the GitHub project. We also use Approval Testing, as not all COBOL test scenarios can be exercised adequately via a unit test framework. This is all documented in the Developer Guide - https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/wiki/Developer-Guide
test_invocation_justification: The buid is designed to be run (a) from a command line, (b) from within an IDE, (c) as part of a CI process. In all those cases, the test suite is initiated with "gradle test".
test_most_justification: This is a fundamental requirement and agreement of the development team.
test_policy_justification: Team policy is to use test-driven development, so the tests of new functionality are written before the production code.
tests_are_added_justification: I don't understand what sort of evidence is required.
tests_documented_added_justification: This is documented in the Developer Guide. https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/wiki/Contributing
warnings_justification: Our policy is to treat compiler warnings as errors. We use Sonar Qube.
warnings_fixed_justification: Our policy is to treat compiler warnings as errors.
warnings_strict_justification: Our policy is to treat compiler warnings as errors.
know_secure_design_justification: Dave Nicolette and Rune Christiansen meet this criterion.
know_common_errors_justification: Dave Nicolette and Rune Christiansen meet this criterion.
crypto_published_justification: Cryptographic mechanisms are not relevant to this software.
crypto_call_justification: Cryptographic mechanisms are not relevant to this software.
crypto_floss_justification: Cryptographic mechanisms are not relevant to this software.
crypto_working_justification: Cryptographic mechanisms are not relevant to this software.
crypto_pfs_justification: Cryptographic mechanisms are not relevant to this software.
crypto_password_storage_justification: No passwords or other sensitive data are stored.
crypto_random_justification: Cryptographic mechanisms are not relevant to this software.
delivery_mitm_justification: HTTPS for downloading executable Java jar files.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: No publicly known vulnerabilities have been reported for this software.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: No publicly known vulnerabilities have been reported for this software.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: Development team policy is not to release, including interim releases, with any unfixed vulnerabilities.
static_analysis_often_justification: Automated pipeline runs static code analysis.
dynamic_analysis_justification: We have not set up dynamic analysis. -------
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: Most of the product is written in Java, which runs under the control of a runtime environment. Some of the code is written in COBOL. We are unaware of any suitable tools for fuzzing or property-based testing of COBOL code. If we learn of any, we will try them.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: We are unaware of any suitable tools for fuzzing or property-based testing of COBOL code. If we learn of any, we will try them.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: Development team policy is not to release, including interim releases, with any unfixed vulnerabilities.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: Cryptographic mechanisms are not relevant to this software.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: We are using Travis CI for this. https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/blob/main/.travis.yml
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
no_leaked_credentials_justification: We depend on GitHub to handle this.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.
maintained_justification:
The project is under active development. As of 23 Jan 2022 there are four team members. One of them is dedicated to the project 12 hours per week by his employer. Another company has expressed interest in assigning an intern to the project. We are in discussions with a university professor who may recommed a student to work on the project, as well. 

Two companies are providing support for development. One of them uses the product and has a keen interest in seeing it evolve and grow. The other, arranged for us by the Open Mainframe Project, is providing access to a Z system for test purposes.

Releases where planned features are targeted are listed as "milestones" on the GitHub issues page. See https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/milestones 

In addition, there is a changelog file accessible from the project's main GitHub page: https://github.com/openmainframeproject/cobol-check/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md

crypto_call_justification: We rely on common libraries for Crypto.

name: lowkey-vault
description: Lowkey Vault is a small test double for Azure Key Vault
description_good_justification: The basic details are described in the Readme.md at the repository root: https://github.com/nagyesta/lowkey-vault/blob/main/README.md
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/nagyesta/lowkey-vault/blob/main/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification:
The basic details are described in the Readme.md at the repository root: https://github.com/nagyesta/lowkey-vault/blob/main/README.md
The usage of the test double is expected to be very similar to using the real Azure Key Vault service, therefore our documentation is only focusing on the differences and starting up the test double.
documentation_interface_justification: We are aiming to build a replica of the Azure Key Vault service REST API, which is linked from our readme. Detailed documentation is not added though.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: We are using feature/bugfix branches for developing the next increment and after the PR-s are merged, CI/CD actions are testing and releasing the code automatically from 'main'.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: We are using semantic versioning with <major>.<minor>.<patch> format
version_tags_justification: Each release is tagged by the CI/CD actions.
release_notes_vulns_justification: No vulnerabilities identified so far in the project codebase.
report_process_justification: We are using a bug template set up for the GitHub issues:  https://github.com/nagyesta/lowkey-vault/issues/new/choose
build_justification: GitHub actions workflow stored together with the source code.
build_common_tools_justification: GitHub actions workflow stored together with the source code.
build_floss_tools_justification: Gradle can build the whole project.
test_justification: Stored together with the source code.
test_most_justification: 97% coverage on CodeCov for the core module. Docker module and end-to-end tests are covering the whole functionality in addition to this.
test_policy_justification: It is only a verbal agreement, but this is definitely checked on code reviews as well.
tests_are_added_justification: Can be checked in our PRs.
crypto_random_justification: This is a test double, not intended to be used in production.
delivery_mitm_justification: This is a test double, not intended to be used in production.
delivery_unsigned_justification: This is a test double, not intended to be used in production.
static_analysis_often_justification: Each release executed them and there are scheduled runs (3 per week) in addition to it.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: App uses TLS1.2 for secure communication. No authentication is required due to the nature of the project. Data is stored in memory and is not intended to contain end user information, therefore it is not encrypted.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: GitHub actions workflow stored together with the source code.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification: The entire project is in English.
hardening_justification: Test double, never used in production. Only ever interacts with test code.
crypto_used_network_justification: App uses TLS1.2 for HTTPS communication.
crypto_tls12_justification: App uses TLS1.2 for HTTPS communication.
crypto_certificate_verification_justific: App uses TLS1.2 for HTTPS communication. Client sets certificate verification to accept self-signed cert. As the client is only intended to be used in tests, it does not affect production.
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: Does not send any headers with private information.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.
installation_common_justification: A single executable Jar or a Docker image can be used. Jars are distributed by GitHub packages and Maven Central.
access_continuity_justification: Maintained by 1 developer at the moment
bus_factor_justification: Maintained by 1 developer at the moment
documentation_current_justification: Quick start documentation is stored together with the code. Wiki is updated after each PR merge if necessary.
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: The end result has no UI intended for end users. The project repository relies on GitHub's UI.
internationalization_justification: The software is not returning text that is intended to show up on the UI. It is simply returning error codes for integrating developers.
sites_password_security_justification: No passwords are needed to access the repository or any of the binary artifacts.
maintenance_or_update_justification: Changes are backward compatible in all cases.
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: There have been no vulnerabilities resolved in the last 12 months
build_standard_variables_justification: Gradle script used for the build, standard Gradle options are usable.
build_preserve_debug_justification: Using default debug configuration of Gradle: https://docs.gradle.org/current/dsl/org.gradle.api.tasks.compile.CompileOptions.html#org.gradle.api.tasks.compile.CompileOptions:debug
build_non_recursive_justification: Gradle ensures dependencies to be enforced.
build_repeatable_justification: All dependencies are using fixed versions, no random parts used during compilation, builds are repeatable.
installation_development_quick_justifica: Gradle (including Gradle Wrapper use) and Docker are the only things you need to build and run app. Dependencies are automatically downloaded.
dependency_monitoring_justification: WhiteSource Bolt and OSS Index Audit are both in place.
updateable_reused_components_justificati: Using Gradle for dependency management. External libraries are defined in Gradle configuration, updating them is being done automatically by Renovate.
interfaces_current_justification: Automated version updates ensure that fresh dependencies are used.
regression_tests_added50_justification: Bugfixes are covered by tests every time.
test_statement_coverage80_justification: Each build collects coverage using JaCoCo. Results published at: https://app.codecov.io/gh/nagyesta/lowkey-vault
input_validation_justification: Input parameters are validated in each case, validation errors result in 400 status responses.
crypto_algorithm_agility_justification: Not relevant: the application is a test double, it is only alive during tests, also the algorithms used by it are bound by Azure API definition.
crypto_credential_agility_justification: Not persisting any data, not storing sensitive personal data.
signed_releases_justification: Signed artifacts (jar, Sources, Javadoc) are hosted on Maven Central.
